name: Ext.supports
doc: Determines information about features are supported in the current environment

members.name: ArraySort
members.doc: True if the Array sort native method isn't bugged.

members.name: AudioTag
members.doc: True if the device supports the HTML5 audio tag

members.name: BoundingClientRect
members.doc: True if the browser supports the getBoundingClientRect method on elements

members.name: CSS3BorderRadius
members.doc: True if the device supports CSS3 border radius

members.name: CSS3BoxShadow
members.doc: True if document environment supports the CSS3 box-shadow style.

members.name: CSS3DTransform
members.doc: True if the device supports CSS3DTransform

members.name: CSS3LinearGradient
members.doc: True if the device supports CSS3 linear gradients

members.name: Canvas
members.doc: True if the device supports Canvas

members.name: ClassList
members.doc: True if document environment supports the HTML5 classList API.

members.name: ComputedStyle
members.doc: True if the browser supports document.defaultView.getComputedStyle()

members.name: CreateContextualFragment
members.doc: True if browser support CreateContextualFragment range native methods.

members.name: DeviceMotion
members.doc: True if the device supports device motion (acceleration and rotation rate)

members.name: Direct2DBug
members.doc: True if when asking for an element's dimension via offsetWidth or offsetHeight, getBoundingClientRect, etc. the browser returns the subpixel width rounded to the nearest pixel.
members.short_doc:
True if when asking for an element's dimension via offsetWidth or offsetHeight,
getBoundingClientRect, etc. ...

members.name: DisplayChangeInputSelectionBug
members.doc:
True if INPUT elements lose their selection when their display style is changed. Essentially, if a text input has focus and its display style is changed, the I-beam disappears.

This bug is encountered due to the work around in place for the RightMargin bug. This has been observed in Safari 4.0.4 and older, and appears to be fixed in Safari 5. It's not clear if Safari 4.1 has the bug, but it has the same WebKit version number as Safari 5 (according to http://unixpapa.com/js/gecko.html).
members.short_doc:
True if INPUT elements lose their
selection when their display style is changed. ...

members.name: DisplayChangeTextAreaSelectionBug
members.doc:
True if TEXTAREA elements lose their selection when their display style is changed. Essentially, if a text area has focus and its display style is changed, the I-beam disappears.

This bug is encountered due to the work around in place for the RightMargin bug. This has been observed in Chrome 10 and Safari 5 and older, and appears to be fixed in Chrome 11.
members.short_doc:
True if TEXTAREA elements lose their
selection when their display style is changed. ...

members.name: Float
members.doc: True if the device supports CSS float

members.name: GeoLocation
members.doc: True if the device supports GeoLocation

members.name: GetPositionPercentage
members.doc: True if the browser will return the left/top/right/bottom position as a percentage when explicitly set as a percentage value.
members.short_doc:
True if the browser will return the left/top/right/bottom
position as a percentage when explicitly set as a percentag...

members.name: History
members.doc: True if the device supports HTML5 history

members.name: LocalStorage
members.doc: True if localStorage is supported

members.name: MouseEnterLeave
members.doc: True if the browser supports mouseenter and mouseleave events

members.name: MouseWheel
members.doc: True if the browser supports the mousewheel event

members.name: Opacity
members.doc: True if the browser supports normal css opacity

members.name: OrientationChange
members.doc: True if the device supports orientation change

members.name: PercentageHeightOverflowBug
members.doc: In some browsers (IE quirks, IE6, IE7, IE9, chrome, safari and opera at the time of this writing) a percentage-height element ignores the horizontal scrollbar of its parent element. This method returns true if the browser is affected by this bug.
members.short_doc:
In some browsers (IE quirks, IE6, IE7, IE9, chrome, safari and opera at the time
of this writing) a percentage-height...

members.name: Placeholder
members.doc: True if the browser supports the HTML5 placeholder attribute on inputs

members.name: PointerEvents
members.doc: True if document environment supports the CSS3 pointer-events style.

members.name: Range
members.doc: True if browser support document.createRange native method.

members.name: RightMargin
members.doc: True if the device supports right margin. See https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=13343 for why this is needed.
members.short_doc: True if the device supports right margin. ...

members.name: RotatedBoundingClientRect
members.doc: True if the BoundingClientRect is rotated when the element is rotated using a CSS transform.

members.name: ScrollWidthInlinePaddingBug
members.doc:
In some browsers the right padding of an overflowing element is not accounted for in its scrollWidth. The result can vary depending on whether or not The element contains block-level children. This method tests the effect of padding on scrollWidth when there are no block-level children inside the overflowing element.

This method returns true if the browser is affected by this bug.
members.short_doc:
In some browsers the right padding of an overflowing element is not accounted
for in its scrollWidth. ...

members.name: Svg
members.doc: True if the device supports SVG

members.name: TextAreaMaxLength
members.doc: True if the browser supports maxlength on textareas.

members.name: TimeoutActualLateness
members.doc: True if the browser passes the "actualLateness" parameter to setTimeout. See: https://developer.mozilla.org/en/DOM/window.setTimeout
members.short_doc:
True if the browser passes the "actualLateness" parameter to
setTimeout. ...

members.name: Touch
members.doc: True if the device supports touch

members.name: Transitions
members.doc: True if the device supports CSS3 Transitions

members.name: TransparentColor
members.doc: True if the device supports transparent color

members.name: Vml
members.doc: True if the device supports VML

members.name: WindowOnError
members.doc: True if browser supports window.onerror.

members.name: xOriginBug
members.doc:
In Chrome 24.0, an RTL element which has vertical overflow positions its right X origin incorrectly. It skips a non-existent scrollbar which has been moved to the left edge due to the RTL setting.

http://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=174656

This method returns true if the browser is affected by this bug.
members.short_doc: In Chrome 24.0, an RTL element which has vertical overflow positions its right X origin incorrectly. ...

members.name: generateVector
members.doc: Generates a support vector for the current browser/mode. The result can be added to supportsVectors to eliminate feature detection at startup time.
members.short_doc: Generates a support vector for the current browser/mode. ...

members.name: init
members.doc:
Runs feature detection routines and sets the various flags. This is called when the scripts loads (very early) and again at Ext.onReady. Some detections are flagged as early and run immediately. Others that require the document body will not run until ready.

Each test is run only once, so calling this method from an onReady function is safe and ensures that all flags have been set.
members.short_doc: Runs feature detection routines and sets the various flags. ...
